lead_paragraph: Justin Morneau, the 2006 American League Most Valuable Player, received the most lucrative contract in Minnesota Twins history, a six-year, $80 million deal announced Friday. The Twins also announced a three-year, $24 million agreement for right fielder Michael Cuddyer. General Manager Bill Smith said the deals did not affect other players.
